results.title: JSA: Joint security area
results.creator_credit: Park Chan-Wook, Lee Eun, CJ Entertainment, KTB Network and Myung Film
results.brief_description: Powerful anti-war drama about an enquiry into the killing of two North Korean soldiers by a South Korean soldier on border patrol. Brought in to stifle a potentially incendiary situation, independent investigating officer Sophie Jean discovers that the group were once unlikely friends, sharing card games and good times. But subsequent enquiries reveal inconsistent versions of the tragic events that followed. A huge hit in Korea and Japan, “JSA” is a humanistic and sensitive examination of the discord between army officialdom and friendships amid supposed enemies. Adapted from the novel by Park Sang-myeon.

results.title: The Party's over = The Last party 2000
results.creator_credit: Donovan, Rebecca Chaiklin, Stanley F Buchthal, Camoflauge, Dakota Group and Palisades Pictures
results.brief_description: Philip Seymour Hoffman hosts an exploration of the state of politics in the United States, leading up to the 2000 election. Hoffman collects a variety of perspectives by attending a Farm Aid concert, various rallies, political conventions, a primary school, a NRA gun show, a Christian coalition, and prison towns. By interviewing the young and old, the famous and the obscure, the filmmakers strive to present a multifarious picture of America. Whilst the results are not polished, the work does capture the scandals of the election, including the faulty ballot cards, re-counts and the decision of the Supreme Court to appoint Bush. Interviews include Willie Nelson, Susan Sarandon, Noam Chomsky, and Michael Moore.

results.title: Mr. Hulot's holiday = M. Hulot's holiday [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jacques Tati, Fred Orain, Discana and Jerome Cady
results.brief_description: In the pipe-smoking daydreamer Mr. Hulot, Jaques Tati created one of the most adored and one of the funniest of screen clowns. In a sleepy seaside resort town, Hulot is the centre of increasing chaos: deckchairs behave anarchically, a summer Ball turns into a disaster. Amidst it all Mr. Hulot wanders around oblivious to the madness. “Mr. Hulot’s Holiday” is a beautifully orchestrated piece of comic cinema and widely considered Tati’s funniest film. Also available on VHS [303607].

results.title: The Living desert
results.creator_credit: James Algar, Ben Sharpsteen and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: A photographic study of plant and animal life in the arid plain which stretches from Oregon to Mexico and from California to Texas. Includes scenes of a death struggle between a hawk and a rattlesnake, an encounter between a bobcat and wild pigs, the pursuit of a kangaroo rat and her babies by a Kingsnake, a contest between two male turtles for the favour of a female, the courtship dance of a pair of scorpions by moonlight, and a time-lapse sequence showing desert wild flowers coming into bloom. Narrated by Winston Hibler.

results.title: Laputa castle in the sky = Tenkuu no Shiro Rapyuta
results.creator_credit: Hayao Miyazaki, Isao Takahata, Tatsumi Yamashita and Studio Ghibli
results.brief_description: Children’s themed anime about a young girl fleeing pirates and corrupted government officials, who pursue her for a magical necklace that she wears. Pazu is the young boy who catches Sheeta as she floats down from the sky, and accompanies her on perilous adventures. Both seek Laputa, Sheeta’s ancestral home and a place of boyhood dreaming for Pazu, an elaborate and alluring Hayao airborne castle. Containing the visual spectacular feast that was the hallmark of “Spirited away”, Miyazaki presents an exciting adventure film, fleshing out his preoccupation with feisty (and imperilled) children, aeronautics and otherworldliness.

results.title: Grave of the fireflies = Hotaru no Haka
results.creator_credit: Isao Takahata, Toru Hara and Studio Ghibli
results.brief_description: Majestic and tragic story of an adolescent boy and his little sister, made homeless by firebombing in Japan at the end of World War II and abandoned by callous relatives. Seita is a wily teenager, with the weight of the world on his shoulders as he seeks to find refuge and food for himself and Setsuko, his four year old sister who longs for their mother. After a disagreement with a distant aunt who briefly takes the pair in, Seita and Setsuko start living in an old shelter by the river. At first life is partially idyllic without adult presence; but soon the realities of homelessness start to take its toll on their health. This evocative and typically exceptional anime from Studio Ghibli, is a moving work and an extraordinary narrative about the Japanese experience of WW2. Disc 2 offers an array of fascinating support material.

results.title: Lumumba
results.creator_credit: Raoul Peck, Jacques Bidou, Arte France, Entre Chien et Loup, Essential Filmproduktion, JBA Productions and Velvet SA
results.brief_description: A political thriller that is the true story of a young African leader, elected at the age of 36 to become the first Prime Minister of the newly independent state of the Congo. Patrice Lumumba (Eriq Ebouaney) in the 1950s was fifty years before his time as he was seeking the ideal of a country free of colonial rule and a true democracy but he became a victim to corruption and powerful international big business interests. The film traces his journey from humble beginnings as a beer salesman to a voice of the people and great leader, finally to his torture and assassination. Powerfully acted and empathetically realised, this story resonates on two levels both as a personal life story of the man but also as an historical political account. Winner of a Peace Award at the Political Film Festival in the United States. A French, Belgian, German, Haitian co-production. Cast includes Alex Descas, Maka Kotto, Theophile Moussa Sowie, Andre Debaar.

results.title: Nausicaa of the valley of the wind = Kaze no Tani no Naushika
results.creator_credit: Hayao Miyazaki, Isao Takahata, Studio Ghibli, Tokuma Shoten and Top Craft
results.brief_description: Ecologically themed anime from famed Japanese director Hayao Miyazaki set in a post apocalyptic world whereby the air is poisoned and insects engage humans in fierce battles. Princess Nausicaa, the fearless leader of her imperilled tribe, is sympathetic to the insects that others fear and loathe, and understands that she must treat them with respect in order to achieve peace. Typically outstanding animation underscores a sensitive and earnest screenplay that, unusually for its time, steers away from the distinctive violence of anime and sets the tone for subsequent Ghibli studio works.

results.title: Greetings
results.creator_credit: Brian De Palma, Charles Hirsch and West End Film
results.brief_description: A film very representative of the era and place in which it was made - New York late 1960s. “Greetings”, directed by Brian De Palma, is about three hip intellectual young men who come up with some novel ideas on how to avoid the draft that will send them to the conflict in Vietnam. Paul (Jonathan Warden), Jon (Robert De Niro) and Lloyd (Geritt Graham) present as gay and extreme right-wingers to the army all the while trying their best to seduce women to keep themselves occupied. This is a witty and satirical view of American culture at the time and is more a series of fun episodes in the protagonists’ lives than a straight-forward narrative. Co-written by Brian De Palma and Charles Hirsch and also edited by De Palma. Music by ‘The Children of Paradise’.

results.title: The Mother (2003)
results.creator_credit: Roger Michell, Kevin Loader and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description: Having spent her whole life in the ‘accepted’ role of wife and mother, elderly May appears distant and unaffectionate. Not very loved by either of her two adult children, May and husband Toots travel to London for a visit with the family. On the sudden death of her husband, May has an affair with a man half her age, who is also her daughter’s boyfriend. The film explores contemporary life in London and the way families live with the dynamic of demands of work and relationships. It also proves age is no reason for loss of sexual desire but what about moral ethics?
